name: Mercure Banbury Whately Hall Hotel

reviews.text: We met friends here and were all delighted with the hotel. Our upgraded rooms were clean, thoughtfully provided with many little extras, and comfortable. The dining room is attractive - and both dinner and breakfast exceeded our expectations. The car parking is good, despite a rather narrow entrance. Yes in an old building there are some creaks, but we enjoyed staying where Swift wrote Gulliver's Travels!
reviews.title: First Travelzoo - won't be last!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We purchased our overnight stay, through an offer by Travel Zoo, and we were not disappointed. We were given an upgrade room, with comfortable bed. Enjoyed a very good evening meal, and a hearty breakfast. The only downside was finding the room, and having to ask where the Restaurant and Breakfast rooms were - felt this information should have been given by Reception when we arrived. The staff were very obliging and helpful when asked anything
reviews.title: Well done Travelzoo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had stayed here before last year and had a lovely time went back to work singing its praises but not this time. We were given a room , dinner and wine as a present all was booked for Saturday we extended our stay to the Friday night too. On arriving mix up with the bookings as they were made separately how ever eventually sorted and we were given a lovely room with separate lounge. Prefect meal gorgeous food Friday night but Saturday our special meal was a let down. Four of us in a dark room, no atmosphere, music in the back ground would have helped. Waitress was so lovely she could not do enough for us as she could see we were disappointed.
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay but disappointed

reviews.text: My Husband an I treated ourselves to a stay in this hotel for our anniversary. Upon arrival we were offered a room "upgrade" which we were happy to pay for, given the occasion. On first inspection, our room appeared to be well decorated, clean, and comfortable. However on close inspection we noticed stains on the carpet, broken floor tiles in the bathroom and stained bedding. My Husband and I requested to move room but were told that there was nowhere else to go. It became aparrent that the room we had originally booked had been double booked, hence the offer of an upgrade. Not knowing the area we had no choice but to make the best of a bad situation. Being an old building we expected a few creaks here and there but we did not anticipate trying to sleep under what sounded like a tenpin bowling alley! I have never had such a bad nights sleep in my life. Breakfast was a buffet style affair. We were seated at our table, got our drinks and returned to the buffet for our food. When we went back to the table another couple had been seated there. The waiting staff were less than helpful, but we were beginning to lower our expectations by then. At dinner we waited an hour and a quarter for a soup which was cold. The following morning my husband and I checked out early and despite our complaints we were not offered so much as an apology. All in all I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Do not be fooled by its flashy facade and website. In all fairness you will have a better stay in a travel lodge!!!!
reviews.title: Would rather stay in a travel lodge...

reviews.text: Just returned from a two night stay and have nothing but good things to say about our visit. Excellent food at both breakfast and dinner, plenty of choice ,food hot , service faultless , must mention Pell so helpful at dinner. Room 115 overlooked the garden, peaceful nights sleep clean comfortable everything you need. A nice touch was two bottles of water provided by the hotel, many five star hotels do not do that. Would definitely return.
reviews.title: Ab fab
Faded and disorganised
reviews.text: Wonderful building, pleasant staff, however restaurant on Sunday night seemed to have very few options, one of which was cottage pie? Really could be better there however the food when it arrived was good, the same sort of lack of detail to the hotel fabric as mentioned by others is true the room was a bit shabby and the tv's would not work, the garden seemed to have borders with beautiful Ross being choked by weeds. The smoked haddock my wife order for breakfast came out as poached eggs for two. There seemed little evidence of team work within the catering staff who got in each others way as much as served the customers, both in the evening and at breakfast. Staff training and fabric care required.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location and fantastic restaurant - the fillet steak was cooked just right (med-rare) which seems to be a problem these days, as most kitchens only want to send out overdone steak with no sign of blood!
reviews.title: Brilliant Banbury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel and found it to be excellent value for money we had a suite at the back of the new section of the hotel on the upper floor.The room was kept well supplied and was cleaned each day the meals were excellently presented and generious portions the staff were polite and courtious .We will stay at this hotel again sometime soon
reviews.title: I WILL BE BACK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from an overnight stay on the way from London to Wales. Due to a double yellow line outside the main entrance, thought we'd better go through to the car park at the rear. This involves going through what must have been the coach entry, so narrow and off putting. However, good parking area once you've girded your loins and driven through. However, you are then faced with a long walk to reception involving a flight of stairs, so not a good start. The receptionist was not the most welcoming person I've come across. There didn't seem to be many people staying, but she couldn't find our pre paid booking. Presumably she eventually did, although she left us standing there for some minutes without communicating with us , as she then asked us to sign in. We had asked for a ground floor room when we booked as I'd read there was no lift, so I was surprised to be put on the second floor. The newer, very ugly, part of the building has a lift, but we were put I the original part of the property. We do not look either particularly young or fit, so locating us up on the second in a reasonably inaccessible position is interesting. We did not purchase this stay as a bargain or last minute deal. The receptionist was surprised when I asked for help with our bag. The situation was salvaged when a young lady who we saw working in the dining room later ensured our bag was brought up. Not only were we on the second floor with no lift, there was a spiral part to the steep staircase and a further 'up & over' part to navigate along the corridore before we got to the room. The room was disappointing - noisy, as it was on the main road, and as it was stuffy, we had to have the window open ( no air cooling); there was a long brown drip on the inside of the bathroom door; the tiles were discoloured (old, rather than dirty) and there were unwholesome marks on the carpet. We love old and period properties, but they can be well kept - this wasn't. However, the staff in the dining room were a delight. The more mature chap and the younger men and women - all cheerful, helpful and working so well as a team. They are the only reason this review is scored as three stars. It certainly wouldn't be if reliant on accessibility, reception on arrival ( excellent on departure), or the room. The food was good in the evening and the breakfast very good.
reviews.title: Lovely Dining Room staff

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night Saturday 18th August. Booked online and when we arrived we found that we had been upgraded to a far better executive room, so spacious, lovely view over gardens. Bed comfortable and everywhere spotless. easy check in and all staff were polite. Breakfast good, usual choices. Checked out at 10am, but were told that we could leave our car in the car park until we were ready to leave Banbury later in the day, saved us having to pay car parking prices elsewhere. Would definitely stay here again
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: A quick one night stay. Excellent value for money. Staff were fabulous. Arrived at hotel at 8.30am and a lovely young guy at reception organised a very early check in for us. Very accommodating and friendly. Very central. Lovely gardens. Room fine, clean and not too small. Great spot.
reviews.title: Excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked here for one night on the way back to the north west from the south coast. The location is great, just off the M40 in the centre of Banbury. The hotel offered free parking, although the entrance to the car park is through a narrow passage that some larger cars might struggle with! The hotel looks lovely from the outside, and the reception area was very nice too - the room let it down as although it was clean it needed a bit of a refurb, mainly the carpet that was rather worn and the windows were old and needed re-painting. That said, the bed was comfy, the TV was huge, the bathroom was lovely and clean with a fab shower. The room had tea/coffee making facilities and a hair dryer, plus an iron and ironing board. We didn't have a view from our room, but the gardens at the back looked lovely. We didn't have breakfast so cannot comment and I think if we had had a better room with a better view, we may have rated it higher, but to us it was just an average hotel - great for a one night stopover. What made it great was the town of Banbury - lots of restaurants, pubs and shops, a great little place. There are two Wetherspoons pubs in walking distance - we had breakfast there for half the price they were charging at the hotel. We ate in a lovely Thai restaurant, Siam House, which is definitely worth a visit.
reviews.title: Great location but needs TLC

reviews.text: Stayed for one night only. Room 141, in the 'new' building behind. The building is showing its age and so is the room I had. That said, the bed was very comfortable - but the shower was pretty pathetic, water dribbled out. Spacious car park but very tight access.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception and breakfast staff were very good, as was breakfast itself. But the room was no more than average.
reviews.title: Obviously once a top hotel, but now jaded.

reviews.text: OK for a night, wouldn't recommend for longer, really.
reviews.title: No room in the restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did enjoy our stay at the Whately Hall, but largely due to the value for money deal we got. £99 for 2 to stay in a suite and get breakfast is a good deal.
reviews.title: shame

reviews.text: We stayed in a suite in the 'new' part of the building, but as that is now 40 years old it is in need a a refurbishment. The carpets leading through the corridors were thinning, as was the carpet in our room. The sagging bed settee in the lounge part of our suite was stained as were the carpets and the path panel was crumbling due to damp, however the room was spotlessly clean with free wifi and 2 LCD TV's. equipment was good with iron, ironing board, fan, hairdryer and trouser press . Tea and coffee making equipment was included as well as complimentary mineral water.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay

description: 3 star hotel offering 69 ensuite rooms in an idyllic 17th Century setting where Jonathan Swift wrote Gulliver's Travels in 1723. Ideal as a base for exploring the Cotswolds region, Stratford Upon Avon, Oxford, Woodstcock & Warwick. 10 minutes from Banbury railway and coach stations, 30 miles (50 km)from Birmingham Airport and easily accessible via Junction 11 of the M40. Features 7 meeting rooms accommodating up to 120 delegates, Swifts & Berkeley Restaurants and Hornton Bar. 24hrs room service and free car parking.
